sentences.english: A shower of filthy abuse came from his lips.
sentences.chinese: 一大堆污言穢語從他嘴裏吐出來。

sentences.english: Never use foul language in front of adults.
sentences.chinese: 請勿在大人面前使用污言穢語。

sentences.english: Pay attention to civilization and manners, not to say bawdry.
sentences.chinese: 講究文明禮貌，不污言穢語。

sentences.english: Strike at 3 mountain company at the same time still have a lot of corrupt character bawdry .
sentences.chinese: 同時砸向三嶺公司的還有許多污言穢語。

definition: to die (idiom)/to breathe one's last/to give up the ghost
to take revenge and wipe out a grudge (idiom)
to plot and kill sb for his property (idiom); to murder for money
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
smile spread across the face (idiom); beaming with pleasure/all smiles/joy written across one's face
to be devoid of all humanity/inhuman/bestial
seize every minute and second (idiom); not a minute to lose/every moment counts
see 心驚膽戰|心惊胆战[xin1 jing1 dan3 zhan4]
fight a battle of words/cross verbal swords
